values.ctor:
<init>(length: Int)
            Creates a new AtomicLongArray of the given length, with all elements initially zero.

<init>(array: LongArray!)
            Creates a new AtomicLongArray with the same length as, and all elements copied from, the given array.

values.code: accumulateAndGet(i: Int, x: Long, accumulatorFunction: LongBinaryOperator!)
values.desc: Atomically updates the element at index i with the results of applying the given function to the current and given values, returning the updated value.
Atomically adds the given value to the element at index i.

values.code: compareAndSet(i: Int, expect: Long, update: Long)
values.desc: Atomically sets the element at position i to the given updated value if the current value == the expected value.
Atomically decrements by one the element at index i.
Gets the current value at position i.

values.code: getAndAccumulate(i: Int, x: Long, accumulatorFunction: LongBinaryOperator!)
values.desc: Atomically updates the element at index i with the results of applying the given function to the current and given values, returning the previous value.
Atomically adds the given value to the element at index i.
Atomically decrements by one the element at index i.
Atomically increments by one the element at index i.
Atomically sets the element at position i to the given value and returns the old value.
Atomically updates the element at index i with the results of applying the given function, returning the previous value.
Atomically increments by one the element at index i.
Eventually sets the element at position i to the given value.
Returns the length of the array.
Sets the element at position i to the given value.
Returns the String representation of the current values of array.
Atomically updates the element at index i with the results of applying the given function, returning the updated value.

values.code: weakCompareAndSet(i: Int, expect: Long, update: Long)
values.desc: Atomically sets the element at position i to the given updated value if the current value == the expected value.
